intro: Oxygraphis subintegra, commonly known as the narrow-leaf oxygraphis, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are elongated and narrow, with a distinctive silvery-gray underside that aids in reflecting sunlight. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in horticultural settings.
